desc.p: Identifies the terminal number on which the user is logged in.
Standard T24 numeric field with maximum of 6 characters.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Holds the ID number of a PHANTOM process. The ID will have a value of zero '0' if the process is not a PHANTOM i.e. if it has been initiated by a system user.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field of maximum 35 characters.
Identifies the Terminal device name.
If the process is a phantom, it contains the value phantom and if the process is a Universe API, it contains the value uvcs else it contains the path of logged user's port number.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field of maximum 35 characters.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 16 characters may be entered.
Identifies the time at which the recorded event took place.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 numeric field of maximum 4 characters.
This field is displayed in the format of HH:MM.
Identifies the record id, which the user is accessing.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field of 35 characters.
Identifies the application, which the user is accessing.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field with maximum of 25 characters.
Identifies the Company whose records were being accessed by the User.
This is the Company name held in Field 1 of the COMPANY record (Ref: General Tables). The Company accessed is determined by the Company Code(s) held in the COMPANY field (Field 5) of the USER record.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field of maximum 16 characters.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the COMPANY file.
Identifies the FUNCTION, which the user is currently using on the record.
Fields USER.NO to PHANTOM.ID form a related multi value set.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field of maximum 1 character.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 16 characters may be entered.
